A
Last modified: Wed Mar 30 11:24:11 NZST 2016
A Sanskrit-English Dictionary - Monier-Williams (Version 0.3 RC1) :: A.

 

A A

the second vowel of the alphabet corresponding to the a in far. _ MW016015 126,1 L=22010

A A

ind. a particle of reminiscence Pāṇ. 1-1 , 14 Pat. _ 126,1 L=22011

A A

ind. also of compassion or pain [more correctly written 1. As q.v.] , and of assent L. [This particle remains unaltered in orthography even before vowels (which causes it to be sometimes confounded with 1. As) Pāṇ. 1-1 , 14.] _ MW016016 126,1 L=22011.1

A A

m. N. of Ziva L. 126,1 L=22012

A A

m. grandfather L. 126,1 L=22013

A A

f. N. of LakshmI L. _ MW016017 126,1 L=22014

A A'

(as a prefix to verbs , especially of motion , and their derivatives) near , near to , towards (see A-√kram &c. ; in the Veda , of course , the prefix is separable from the verb ; in a few cases ṚV. i , 10 , 11 and v , 64 , 5, a verb in the imperative is to be supplied ; with roots like gam , yA , and i , ` to go ' , and 1. dA , ` to give ' , it reverses the action ; e.g. A-gacchati , ` he comes ' ; A-datte , ` he takes '). (As a prep. with a preceding acc.) near to , towards , to ṚV. 126,1 _ L=22015

A A'

(with a preceding noun in the acc. , as jo'Sam or va'ram) for ṚV. 126,1 _ L=22015.05

A A'

(with a following acc.) up to .. exclusively AitBr. 126,1 _ L=22015.10

A A'

(with a preceding abl.) from ṚV. AV. 126,1 _ L=22015.15

A A'

out of , from among (e.g. bahu'bhya A' , ` from among many ') ṚV. 126,1 _ L=22015.20

A A'

towards (only in asma'd A' , ` towards us ') ṚV. 126,1 _ L=22015.25

A A'

(with a following abl. cf. Pāṇ. 2-1 , 13 & 3 , 10) up to , to , as far as ṚV. AV. &c. 126,1 _ L=22015.30

A A'

from ṚV. i , 30 , 21 126,1 _ L=22015.35

A A'

(with a preceding loc.) in , at , on ṚV. AV. (As an adv. after words expressing a number or degree) fully , really , indeed (e.g. tri'r A' diva's , ` quite or fully three times a day ' ; mahimA' vAm i'ndrA^gnI pa'niSTha A' , ` your greatness , O Indra and Agni , is most praiseworthy indeed ' , &c.) ṚV. 126,1 _ L=22015.40

A A'

(after a subst. or adj.) ` as , like ' , (or it simply strengthens the sense of the preceding word) ṚV. , (after a verb) ṚV. v , 7 , 7 KenaUp. Page126,2 126,1 _ L=22015.45

A A'

(as a conjunctive particle) moreover , further , and (it is placed either between the two words connected [rarely after the second ṚV. x , 16 , 11, or after both ṚV. x , 92 , 8] or, if there are more , after the last [ṚV. iv , 57 , 1 and x , 75 , 5] ; see also A^taz ca s.v.) In classical SanskRit it may denote the limit ` to ' , ` until ' , ` as far as ' , ` from ' , either not including the object named or including it (sometimes with acc. or abl. or forming an adv.) e.g. A-maraNam or A-maraNAt , ` till death ' Pañcat. (cf. A-maraNA^nta &c.) _ 126,2L=22015.50

A A'

A-gopAlA dvijAtayaH , ` the twice-born including the cowherds ' MBh. ii , 531 126,2 _ L=22015.55

A A'

A-samudram or A-samudrAt , ` as far as the ocean ' or ` from the ocean ' (but not including it) 126,2 _ L=22015.60

A A'

A-kumAram , ` from a child ' or ` from childhood ' or ` to a child ' (cf. Lat. a puero) MBh. iii , 1403 126,2 _ L=22015.65

A A'

A-kumAram yazaH pANineH , ` the fame of PANini extends even to children ' 126,2 _ L=22015.70

A A'

AjAnu-bAhu mfn. ` one whose arms reach down to the knees ' R. i , 1 , 12 126,2 _ L=22015.75

A A'

(see also AkarNa- and Ajanma-) 126,2 _ L=22015.80

A A'

(cf. A-jarasa'm , A-vyuSa'm , A-saptama , o^tsUya'm.) Prefixed to adj. [rarely to subst. ; cf. A-kopa] it implies diminution Pāṇ. 2-2 , 18 Comm. ` a little ' e.g. A-piJjara mfn. a little red , reddish Ragh. xvi , 51 125,2 _ L=22015.85

A A'

(see also A-pakva , o^SNa , &c.) Some commentaries (e.g. Comm. on Ragh. iii , 8) occasionally give to A in this application the meaning samantAt , ` all through , completely ' , as A-nIla , ` blue all round. ' 125,2 _ MW016018 L=22015.90

AprI A-prI'

f. pl. (-pri'yas [AV. xi , 7 , 19] and -pryas [NArAyaNa] N. of particular invocations spoken previous to the offering of oblations (according to ĀśvŚr. iii , 2 , 5 seqq. they are different in different schools ; e.g. sa'middho agni'r ṚV. v , 28 , 1, in the school of Zunaka ; juSa'sva naH ṚV. vii , 2 , 1, in that of VasishTha ; sa'middho adya' ṚV. x , 110 , 1, in that of others ; NArAyaNa on this passage gives ten hymns belonging to different schools ; see also Sāy. on ṚV. i , 13 [su'samiddho na A' vaha , the AprI-hymn of the school of KaNva] , who enumerates twelve AprIs and explains that twelve deities are propitiated ; those deities are personified objects belonging to the fire-sacrifice , viz. the fuel , the sacred grass , the enclosure , &c. , all regarded as different forms of Agni ; hence the objects are also called AprIs , or , according to others , the objects are the real AprIs , whence the hymns received their names) AV. Ayurveda Ayur--veda

m. the science of health or medicine (it is classed among sacred sciences , and considered as a supplement of the Atharva-veda ; it contains eight departments: 1. Zalya or (removal of) any substance which has entered the body (as extraction of darts , of splinters , &c.) ; 2. ZAlAkya or cure of diseases of the eye or ear &c. by ZalAkAs or sharp instruments ; 3. KAya-cikitsA or cure of diseases affecting the whole body ; 4. BhUtavidyA or treatment of mental diseases supposed to be produced by demoniacal influence ; 5. KaumAra-bhRitya or treatment of children Page149,1 ; 6. Agada-tantra or doctrine of antidotes ; 7. RAsAyana-tantra or doctrine of elixirs ; 8. VAjIkaraNa-tantra or doctrine of aphrodisiacs Suśr. MBh. Hariv. &c.) 148,3L=25890

Azrama A-zrama

mn. a stage in the life of a BrAhman (of which there are four corresponding to four different periods or conditions , viz. 1st , BrahmacArin , ` student of the Veda ' ; 2nd , GRiha-stha , ` householder ' ; 3rd , VAnaprastha , ` anchorite ' ; and 4th , SaMnyAsin , ` abandoner of all worldly concerns ' , or sometimes Bhikshu , ` religious beggar ' ; in some places the law-givers mention only three such periods of religious life , the first being then omitted) Mn. Kathās. &c. ; to call to (especially in rites said of the HotRi , who addresses the Adhvaryu by the A-hAva or A-hvAna ; see below) AitBr. ĀśvŚr. KātyŚr. ŚāṅkhBr. and ŚāṅkhŚr. ; to proclaim AitBr. ŚBr. KātyŚr. ĀśvŚr. : Caus. -hvAyayati , to cause to call near , send for ; to cause to summon or challenge or invite R. Ragh. Bhaṭṭ. : Desid. -juhUSati , to wish to call near , to be about to call near: Intens. A'-johavIti ṚV. vii , 56 , 18 , to call near zealously. _ MW020098 163,2 L=28496
